VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Total Energy Generated stage positioned above or below the Post-Generation stage?
SRP.A: The Total Energy Generated stage is positioned {above} the Post-Generation stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Generation?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Generation is {40583}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Distribution?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Distribution is {15003}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Total Energy Generated?
VE.A: The value of stage Total Energy Generated is {66189}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Total Energy Generated, with a value of {66189}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Billed Consumption, with a value of {12748}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Delivered to End Users to stage Billed Consumption?
SC.A: Decreased by {2255} Megawatt Hours from stage Delivered to End Users to stage Billed Consumption.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Post-Distribution to stage Delivered to End Users?
SC.A: Decreased by {0} Megawatt Hours from stage Post-Distribution to stage Delivered to End Users.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 53386? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 13875? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 13875 and 33094? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Post-Transmission} stage has {25605}, the {Post-Distribution} stage has {15003}, the {Delivered to End Users} stage has {15003}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Post-Transmission to Post-Distribution, or from stage Post-Generation to Post-Transmission?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Generation} to {Post-Transmission} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Post-Transmission to Post-Distribution, or from stage Total Energy Generated to Post-Generation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Total Energy Generated} to {Post-Generation} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Post-Generation to Post-Transmission, from stage Post-Distribution to Delivered to End Users, or from stage Post-Transmission to Post-Distribution?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Generation} to stage {Post-Transmission} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Total Energy Generated} and {Post-Generation} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Post-Distribution} and {Delivered to End Users} stages.
